CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Finn, steelworker, 234 Burrows Street, and Mr. James F. Fisher, steelworker, 2139 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "Perhaps the reason is the fact that the juries are compose entirely of whites. Perhaps this is the reason that a couple of weeks ago a tavern owner who practically admitted afterwards that he discriminated, was freed of the charge."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Charles Finn, and James F. Fisher, wearing dark grid patterned cap, patterned shirt with buttoned down collar, and leather jacket, holding paper bag, standing in front of building with address ...440, and shopping cart in background
